intro: Hieracium triste subsp. gracile, commonly known as slender spearthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
